Hi Derek,

> I guess your friend isn't on this list? Has she actually run any
> simple simulations using this implementation? My advisor is a big fan
> of Izhikevich, so I'm interested to hear how those are working out.

She was on the list, I don't think she is anymore (need to talk to
her!). Anyways, the Izhikevich model has a simple working example. If
you have Python installed, try this:

python network.py (network.py is in /trunk/neat/iznn)

It prints to screen the membrane potential for each time step and
outputs a graph if you have the required libraries. Here's an example:

www.ime.usp.br/~cesargm/spiking_neuron.svg

For STDP and related issues, I'd recommend you to check out this guy's
website: http://www.coneural.org/florian/ -- Razvan Florian has some
nice papers on that subject and he's mostly concerned with using
spiking networks for robot controlling. His work is much more applied
than theoretical, so it's much easier to grasp those learning methods
for SNNs.

[]'s
Cesar
